summary: This is a letter from attorney Bradley Edwards to a U.S. Attorney, responding to a July 25, 2008 letter regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. Edwards addresses the U.S. Attorney's Office's change in position on working out undisputed facts, proposes additional stipulations about the non-prosecution agreement, and requests production of documents including the full agreement and victim interview reports.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Author of the letter, representing victims (including Jane Doe #1) in the Epstein case. He is negotiating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about stipulating facts and requesting documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement and Florida state court guilty pleas. He is identified as the man who committed sexual crimes against the attorney's clients.

persons.name: Jane Doe #1
persons.context: One of the victims represented by Bradley Edwards. She was sent a victim notification on July 9, 2008, via her attorney.

connections.description: Edwards is the attorney representing Jane Doe #1, as indicated by the victim notification sent to her via him.
Edwards, representing victims, is legally opposing Epstein and seeking accountability through the court process regarding the non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Epstein's guilty pleas and sentencing in Florida
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered guilty pleas in Florida State Court, was sentenced, and imprisoned in Palm Beach County.

events.title: Negotiation of non-prosecution agreement
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement was negotiated between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jeffrey Epstein, and amended twice more during that year.

events.title: Victim notification to Jane Doe #1
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a victim notification to Jane Doe #1 via her attorney, Bradley Edwards, containing a written explanation of the terms of the non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Office letter indicating change of course
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a letter indicating a change of course and an apparent decision not to attempt to work out undisputed facts in the case.

keyFacts: A non-prosecution agreement between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida was negotiated in September 2007, amended twice, and precludes federal prosecution for sex crimes against the victims.

The victims and their attorneys were not told about the non-prosecution agreement until after June 30, 2008, due to an express confidentiality provision complied with by the U.S. Attorney's Office, FBI, and other federal agents.
Jeffrey Epstein entered guilty pleas in Florida State Court on June 30, 2008, was sentenced, and imprisoned in Palm Beach County.

Bradley Edwards requests a true and accurate copy of the complete non-prosecution agreement, victim interview reports from the FBI or U.S. Attorney's Office, and assistance in securing a transcript of the hearing on the victims' petition.
